title: SB 1.18.47 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 29-04-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and invocations.

segments.key_quote: So this is the statement of Suta Goswami to the sages of Naimisharanya.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and sets the context of Pariksit Maharaj's story.

segments.key_quote: When an offense is done unto the devotee of the Lord it is very difficult to overcome the reaction.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the law of karma and the severe consequences of offending a devotee of the Lord (Vaishnava Aparadh).

segments.key_quote: Generally Vaishnava Aparath cannot be overcome.
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing Vaishnava Aparadh, emphasizing the responsibility of Brahmanas to protect subordinates and avoid disproportionate punishment.

segments.key_quote: Above the law of nature is the Supreme Lord's personal superintendence.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the specific case of Pariksit Maharaj's cursing, highlighting the foolish boy's pride and emphasizing Krishna's personal control over nature.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is the supreme director, controller, master.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's supreme control and administration, His affection for devotees (Bhakta Vatsala), and the distinction between sin and offense.

segments.key_quote: Offense is dealt with only by the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to differentiate between sin and offense, emphasizing that only the Supreme Lord can pardon offenses and alter the laws of nature.

segments.key_quote: Even the laws of nature which work perfectly they can be changed only by Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates Krishna's power to change the laws of nature and raises the question of why the Brahmana's son was made responsible for cursing Pariksit Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: So Krishna arranged a child to make a mistake of cursing Pariksit.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna arranged for a child to commit the offense so that he could be easily excused, and the father's prayer would be accepted.

segments.key_quote: Why the Brahmana community as a whole was made responsible for allowing Kali into the world affairs.
segments.summary: The speaker raises the question of why the entire Brahmana community is held responsible for Kali's influence and explains that demons were allowed to take birth in Brahmana families in Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: The all-merciful Lord gave them a chance to have their births in families of pious Brahmanas so that they could progress towards salvation.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by explaining that the demons were given a chance for purification by taking birth in Brahmana families, but they often misuse the opportunity due to pride and vanity, ending with a thank you and Hare Krishna.
